items.prompt: Complete: My ____ is Anna.
review_tags: A1: family vocabulary in subject position

items.prompt: Choose: We ____ from Italy.
Choose the correct question word: ____ old are you?
Choose the correct past: I ____ my keys yesterday.
review_tags: B1: Past Simple vs Present Perfect

items.prompt: Choose the correct relative pronoun: The woman ____ lives next door is a doctor.
Choose: Hardly ____ we arrived when the meeting started.
Write the correct form of 'to be': I ____ a student.
Past of 'to be': They ____ at home yesterday.
Present Perfect with 'already': I have ____ finished my homework.
Reported speech: “I can’t help you,” she said. → She said she ____ help me.
Use a mixed conditional: If I ____ (study) more, I ____ (have) a better job now.
Use a cleft sentence: 'Marketing overlooked the data.' → It ____ the data that marketing overlooked.
Transform using inversion for emphasis: I had never heard such an absurd claim. (Begin with "Never...")
Add an appropriate linker of contrast: ____ the risks, the committee proceeded.
Choose the correct article: ___ apple a day keeps the doctor away.
Complete with a possessive: This is ____ book. (I)
Present Continuous: She ____ (cook) dinner right now.
Past Simple: We ____ (not/watch) TV last night.
Complete (one word each): If it ____ (rain), we ____ (stay) at home.
Question tags: You’ve finished, ____?
Relative clause: The book, ____ I bought yesterday, is fascinating.
Passive nuance: They ____ (award) him a prize last year.
Emphatic do: I ____ appreciate your help.
Subjunctive: It is essential that he ____ (be) on time.
Nominalisation: Rewrite using noun form of 'fail'.
answer: There was a failure to meet targets

Choose: By the time we arrived, they ____ already left.

items.prompt: Type a suitable word: It is very ____ today. (hot / warm / cold)
A place where you buy food: ____
Choose: I ____ coffee.
Complete: This is my ____ (mother’s brother).
Opposite of 'big': ____
Choose the best option: I usually ____ the bus to work.
Give one opposite of 'cheap'.
Type a suitable phrasal verb: Please ____ this form.
Word meaning 'a short trip for pleasure': ____
Choose: She feels ____ (not well).
Closest meaning of 'reliable'.
Complete: She has a strong ____ for languages.
Phrasal verb: Can you ____ (take care of) my cat?
A word meaning 'fair and not influenced by personal feelings': ____
Choose the best collocation: highly ____ (recommended / recommendedly)
One verb meaning 'to make something happen sooner': ____
Strong collocate with 'heavy': ____
Noun from 'persist': ____
Choose the best synonym of 'drawback'.
Adjective meaning 'able to be defended against attack or objection': ____
Near-synonym for 'mitigate' (one word).
Adjective: 'very careful and exact'.

Word meaning 'accepted without being stated': ____

Choose the right form: 'I look forward ____ from you.' (to hear/hearing)

Correct word: 'We made a big ____ in the report.' (error/mistake)
Choose: 'I’ve lived here ____ 2019.' (for/since)
Word formation: We must improve our energy ______ (efficient) at home.
Provide a strong collocate for 'heavy' (e.g., heavy ____).
Use a contrast linker (one word): 'He studied hard. ____ he failed.'
Paraphrase with one word only: 'make something less severe' → ______
Fixed expression: Complete 'by and ____' (meaning 'generally').
Provide a strong collocate for 'commit' (e.g., commit ____).

items.tts_text: Hi! The museum opens at nine and closes at six. What time does it open?
items.prompt: Listen and answer (number only): What time does the museum open?

items.tts_text: Your order will arrive on Tuesday morning. Please make sure someone is home to sign for it.
items.prompt: What day will the order arrive?

items.tts_text: The café is closed on Mondays but open from eight to five the rest of the week.
items.prompt: On which day is the café closed? (one word)

items.tts_text: Please take the first left, then go straight for two blocks. The library is on your right.
items.prompt: Which side is the library on? (left/right)

items.tts_text: Good afternoon. The gym is open from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. on weekdays, and from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. at weekends.
items.prompt: Until what time is the gym open on weekdays? (number only)

items.tts_text: The meeting has been moved from Friday to Thursday at the same time.
items.prompt: What day is the meeting now?

items.tts_text: The restaurant offers a set menu at twelve ninety-five, including a drink and dessert.
items.prompt: How much is the set menu? (numbers and punctuation allowed)

items.tts_text: Please remember to submit your travel expenses by the end of the month.
items.prompt: By when must expenses be submitted? (short)

items.tts_text: Due to engineering works, all southbound trains will be delayed by approximately twenty minutes. Passengers for Brighton should use platform four.
items.prompt: How long are trains delayed?

items.tts_text: The quarterly report indicates a rise in revenue but a decline in customer retention.
items.prompt: Name one metric that declined. (short)

items.tts_text: We advise you to back up your files regularly to avoid data loss during updates.
items.prompt: Why should you back up files? (two words)

items.tts_text: Work on the main auditorium will commence at 9 a.m., with noise expected throughout the morning.
items.prompt: When will work commence? (format flexible)

items.tts_text: While the pilot study suggests a positive trend, the sample size was too small to draw firm conclusions.
items.prompt: Why can't firm conclusions be drawn? (short phrase)

items.tts_text: Please note that the keynote has been brought forward to nine-thirty, so arrive fifteen minutes earlier to register.
items.prompt: What time is the keynote now?

items.tts_text: The board approved the budget on condition that expenditures exceeding five thousand be pre-authorised.
items.prompt: What must happen for expenses over 5000? (short)

items.tts_text: Although the application is intuitive, first-time users may benefit from the guided tour.
items.prompt: Who might benefit from the guided tour? (short)

items.tts_text: Far from endorsing the proposal, the committee merely agreed to revisit it pending further evidence.
items.prompt: Did the committee endorse the proposal? (yes/no)

items.tts_text: Notwithstanding the clear advantages, the transition entails considerable upfront costs and operational disruption.
items.prompt: Name one downside mentioned. (short)

items.tts_text: Only by triangulating multiple data sources can we approximate the ground truth.
items.prompt: What must be triangulated? (short)

items.tts_text: Should you require assistance, our analysts—rather than our sales team—will handle your query.
items.prompt: Who will handle your query? (short)

items.passage: Many people assume that working from home automatically increases productivity. However, research shows mixed results: while some enjoy fewer distractions, others struggle to separate work and personal life, leading to burnout.
items.question: What is the main idea?
options: Working from home always increases productivity.
The impact of working from home on productivity is not the same for everyone.
Working from home causes burnout for everyone.
items.answer: The impact of working from home on productivity is not the same for everyone.

items.passage: Tickets can be refunded only within seven days of purchase and must be accompanied by a receipt.
items.question: State one condition for a refund (short).

items.passage: Guests are requested to vacate their rooms by 11 a.m.; late check-out is subject to availability and an additional fee.
items.question: What time must guests leave by? (short)

items.passage: Bicycles must be stored in the designated racks. Any bicycles left in corridors will be removed.
items.question: Where must bicycles be stored? (short)

items.passage: Although the team missed its quarterly targets, the new onboarding program significantly reduced staff turnover.
items.question: Which statement is supported?
options: Targets were met but turnover increased.
Targets were missed but turnover fell.
items.answer: Targets were missed but turnover fell.

items.passage: The schedule lists several workshops running concurrently, requiring attendees to choose which to prioritise.
items.question: What constraint do attendees face? (short)

items.passage: Research indicates that moderate exercise improves cognitive function, particularly memory consolidation, in older adults.
items.question: Which cognitive function is highlighted? (one word)

items.passage: The policy will be trialled for six months, after which data will be evaluated to decide on wider implementation.
items.question: How long will the trial last? (short)

items.passage: Although the policy promised to streamline reporting, the additional compliance checks inadvertently prolonged approval times.
items.question: In one short phrase, what was the unintended consequence?

items.passage: The author contends that universal basic income could bolster entrepreneurship, yet warns that without price controls it may fuel inflation.
items.question: What is the author's stance?
options: Entirely supportive of universal basic income.
Supportive but concerned about inflation without safeguards.
items.answer: Supportive but concerned about inflation without safeguards.

items.passage: The committee's silence should not be construed as agreement; rather, it reflects a desire to postpone a contentious decision.
items.question: How should the committee's silence be interpreted? (short)

items.passage: Despite its rhetorical elegance, the speech offered little in terms of actionable policy.
items.question: What was lacking in the speech? (short)

items.passage: Far from being merely decorative, the footnotes constitute a parallel argument that destabilises the apparent certainty of the main text.
items.question: In one precise phrase, what role do the footnotes play?

items.passage: The study's methodological opacity undermines the replicability of its findings, casting doubt on its purported robustness.
items.question: Name one critical problem identified. (short)

items.passage: Only by situating the anecdote within its broader socio-historical context can we appreciate its polemical force.
items.question: What must the anecdote be situated within? (short)

items.passage: The author's concessive moves mask an underlying equivocation that remains unresolved in the conclusion.
items.question: What remains unresolved? (one word)

items.passage: Pre-registration is required due to limited seating; walk-ins will be admitted only if space permits.
items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.passage: Pre-registration is required due to limited seating; walk-ins will be admitted only if space permits.
items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.passage: Pre-registration is required due to limited seating; walk-ins will be admitted only if space permits.
items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.passage: Pre-registration is required due to limited seating; walk-ins will be admitted only if space permits.
items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.passage: Pre-registration is required due to limited seating; walk-ins will be admitted only if space permits.
items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.passage: Pre-registration is required due to limited seating; walk-ins will be admitted only if space permits.
items.question: What is required before the event? (short)

items.prompt: Write 120–180 words: Describe a time when you had to learn something quickly. Explain what strategies you used and what you would do differently now.
review_tags: B2: range of tenses & linking devices
C2: precision and nuance in argumentation

items.prompt: Write 140–190 words: Do you agree that remote work should remain the default option for office jobs? Present a balanced argument and a clear conclusion.
Write 120–170 words: Describe a challenging conversation you handled. How did you manage tone and outcome?
Write 150–200 words: Evaluate the pros and cons of using AI tools in education, proposing two practical guidelines for ethical use.
Write 120–170 words: A friend asks for advice about preparing for a job interview. Give structured, practical advice.
Write 160–210 words: Summarise a recent article you read and critically respond to one of its claims.
Write 120–180 words: Describe a time when you had to learn something quickly. Explain what strategies you used and what you would do differently now.
review_tags: B2: range of tenses & linking devices
C2: precision and nuance in argumentation
